result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Case transferred per Chief Judge Directive 20-03A.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received 8-31-15 from the Department of Treasury a Notice of Proposed Penalty for late or incomplete Form 8300. Agent C Thomas informed me some identification needed to be provided for the defendant. The DA's office provided a DL #. An amended form was mailed to Agent Thomas 9-14-15, Tom.
NO REPLY FROM SURETY OR DEFENDANT.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($20,000.00) ad

Attorney Chris Hartley for Mark A Pecora in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failed to appear.  Court ordered a Bench Warrant to issue REMAND to Court.  Court ordered any cash bail on deposit forfeited.

Attorney Mark A Pecora in court, defendant Francisco Chavez-Reynoso not in court, in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
State withdraws their motion to modify bail conditions. Case remains calendared for STATUS on 4/3/2015.
to Set Condition of Bond, filed by the State. sab

Attorney Mark A Pecora in court, defendant Francisco Chavez-Reynoso not in court, in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail amended to $20,000.00 cash. All other conditions remain.
for Modification of Bail received and filed. sab

Defendant Francisco Chavez-Reynoso in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Defendant Francisco Chavez-Reynoso in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Claudia S; Luis S; Tudi M; Adam V; Wally F.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Francisco Chavez-Reynoso in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  
Defendant Francisco Chavez-Reynoso in custody.  
Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT HAS OBTAINED PRIVATE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
